body.name: VRPEFIT Smart Watch for Men Women, Activity Fitness Tracker with Blood Oxygen Heart Rate Sleep Monitor, 1.69" DIY Full Touch Display smartwatch for iPhone Android Phone, 5ATM Waterproof
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 16 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 13. Order within 8 hrs 40 mins
FREE delivery Saturday, February 17 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 8 hrs 40 mins
features: ✨【Notification & Alexa】--See Calls & Messages on the smartwatch！(but can not reply) Receive notifications on display like, call, weather, SMS and SNS (Facebook, WhatsApp, LinkedIn, Instagram, and Twitter etc.) ; Vibrates to notify you,helping you stay be notified; reminds you to move after periods of inactivity. As for Alexa ,ask it what you want to know, such as schedules, workout results, health data, and a variety of questions. Then you will get respones.

✨【Health Monitoring & 5ATM Waterproof】--It monitors your heart rate 24h/d, blood oxygen, pay attention to your health at all times, record physical changes, and let you know more about your physical condition. All of which can be operated on the watch and data can be viewed on the fitness watch or in the app. Tracks your time during light sleep, deep sleep, and awake sleep also. 5ATM waterproof function which is not limited in outdoor activities and swimming.

✨【Fitness Tracker and other Functions】--The fitness watch has 20 exercise modes for daily workouts (walking, running, biking, swimming, etc.) The watch can display statistics such as calories, exercise duration and distance.The smart watch for men and women also has alarm clock, stopwatch, timer, deep breathing guide, music and phone camera controller, weather, find your phone, etc.

✨【Battery and Compatibility】--It can be used for 5-15 days with a full charge. *Usage time varies depending on the level of use. The smartwatch is available for iOS/Android phones. Supports smartphones with IOS 9.0 or above, Android 6.0 or above. One-year warranty is offered. Please feel free to contact us if you have any problems.

✨【1.69 "Custom Dials & No Charge APP】--This fitness watch has dials that you can choose directly from veryfit APP, and also supports you to customize any picture on your phone. APP is no charge, and it will help you to assist the use of the watch. Please download and install "VeryFit" APP on your phone when you first use the watch.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Are there more detailed instructions for use ? Open VeryfitAPP - Device - How to use. Why is my watch disconnected ? In the App: authorize the watch to receive messages. Do not enable the DND mode. Is it compatible with both Android and iOS systems? Yes, our watch is compatible with Android 6.0 and above, as well as iOS 9.0 and above. Does this watch have a waterproof feature? Our watch is equipped with a waterproof feature that allows you to engage in activities such as swimming without any limitations. Can the watch receive message notifications? You can receive notifications on the smartwatch, such as weather updates, SMS, and SNS (Facebook, WhatsApp, LinkedIn, Instagram, Twitter, etc.), to keep you informed at all times. However, you cannot initiate or send text messages from the smartwatch

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I wear my sports watch every day. It shows me how well I sleep at night and how my blood pressure is. It was a good purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my wife and she loved it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My biggest problem with this watch is the sleep recording. It's consistently inaccurate. I've had it for 10 days, it was right on my sleep twice. Lasts for over two days on battery without charging, which is nice. Have worn it in the shower with no issues. Stress is also off a bit. Finally, steps are a bit off. I stand and walk most of my shift at work. Some days I've had 15k steps and some under 5k. It's not really possible, considering my job, to be so far off.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Everything a SmartWatch does but make calls
reviews.reviewText: I wanted a watch that would track heart rate, steps, calories, and blood oxygen. This does all that for me plus sends me notifications from my phone.This does everything a smart watch would do aside from making calls/texts. I'm very pleased so far.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Overall amazing product
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. The watch has so many different options and in the app you’re allowed to have custom wallpapers as well, from getting notifications to playing ur music through the phone and to finding your phone. this watch is amazing. For some reason my watch was set to max brightness and it killed the battery life really fast until i realized and ever since it’s only gone down like 10% in 2 hours. I was quite scared to buy this product from the bad reviews but idk what they’re talking about tbh.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Inaccurate data, Alexa function not working, and laggy.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because I thought you were able to download/get apps on it , as well as the description mentioned in the titles functions. It came fast, but I open the watch, it doesn't come charged from the factory, so I charge it. The watch turns on properly, but the default watch face is hideous. I scroll through the pages on the watch, the only features are: heart rate, steps, blood pressure, clock, Alexa, and a flashlight. I tested it out, none of the data is accurate. The Alexa needed to connect to an Alexa device, which was a bit frustrating, but I did connect it to my Alexa device anyways But, it doesn't work. I do some troubleshooting, nothing's working. I finally get it connected, and the answers are all wonky, and the Alexa feature was autoset to Spanish. I ended up returning the watch. I don't recommend buying this if you're looking for accurate data.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Stopped working and charging after 30days. Now can't even exchange it. It's crap. Spend a little more for better quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Pay for what you get
reviews.reviewText: This watch is definitely a pay for what you get. I was not expecting anything amazing for $20. However I will say I have seen similarly priced watches that tell you when someone’s calling, or text notifications, etc.So I wouldn’t say that this does that. It’s just your basic interface watch.
Nice watch. looks good, feels good, works well. I've had it on for 5 days now and the battery is at 53% so I'd say the battery life is good. Great value for the price.
I've had 2 of them and they stopped working. They also take a lot of memory on my phone

I wore this product when doing exercises. It measures my calories and heart rate which I really love. The battery even last 5days when i first used it. It notifies me of any calls and messages. The price is also reasonable. Glad to have ☝️ one.
I love knowing my heart rate, and how many steps I take in a day! I find it interesting to keep track of my walking and exercise! The sleep time summary is not always correct in the time

reviews.reviewTitle: Good value, but wrist strap is short.
reviews.reviewText: My wife had originally purchased this watch for her based on the positive reviews. I then purchased one for myself, mainly to track my sleep quality. Works fine, but the wrist strap is a few notches too small for this man's wrist. The consequence is that it is over-tight on my wrist, leaving a deep indentation and some skin irritation as well. I would say that I have an average+ size wrist. As I mainly wear it at night, this isn't a problem, but if I wanted to wear it 24/7, it might be.
